fields.description: Not sure when this behavior was introduced, but login profiles and access keys should not be created automatically at account creation unless explicitly requested by the account creator. Not every user in the cloud would necessarily needs to use the console and the CLI. it's a bad security practice to creating credentials for interfaces that are not going to be used and there should be a way to specify which credentials should be created if desired. Create account != create credentials.

attachment.filename: Create new account - no check boxes.png
Create new user - unchecked check boxes.png

fields.summary: Credentials should not be automatically created at account creation

comments.body: There are checkboxes to create a random password and access keys when creating users. Account creation should work similarly.

We did that because if using the console to create accounts, there is no way to then use that account to login unless we provide the login profile. It would be really bad UX to require a user to go to cmd-line tools. ([~jloza]) If an admin wants to do this outside the console, they have options.

It's not true in a general situation that every created account needs access to both the console and CLI. Some accounts might only need access to the console, some only to CLI, some to both. That's why having an option to choose what credentials to create (if any at all) is better than create them as a side effect of account create. That's especially important for account admin's credentials because they give full access to the account and never should be created without a need.

I can understand adding an "opt out" on creating login profile. I also imagine you'd want that an "opt in". I'd recommend the former because using the console for creating accounts is probably an indication that that's what the organization caters to (console users). Not 100%, but probably the trend and we like to get it right most of the time. :-)
Just work just like create user does. Checkboxes exist, should be checked by default

Hi, Adam.

I¹m not seeing the checked check boxes when a user does ³Create New
Account² (see attachment).

Incidentally, should the check boxes be checked on the ³Create New User²
page, too?


Lawrence




On 10/29/15, 6:26 PM, "Adam Shamblin (JIRA)"

For Create New Account, verified on MacBook running Chrome 46.0.2490.71 (64-bit), Firefox (41.0.2), and Safari.

UX review complete. Ready for code review.

Also, from [~lnajjar]: 

_[~jloza], your comment on GUI-2190 led to some discussion in today’s scrum._

_You wrote: Just work just like create user does. Checkboxes exist, should be checked by default_

_So, the Create New Account checkboxes should be checked (see attachment)._

_Should the Create New User checkboxes be checked (see attachment)?_

From [~jloza]:

_Yes. Default box state should be checked._



I will create a ticket to check the checkboxes on Create New User. (Note: I created [https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/browse/GUI-2210])
[~ccassler]: I merged PR 1690, but I'll hold this in QA since that PR set GUI-2168 as the target brach.  Will reassign to you once the PR for GUI-2168 is merged.

Verified.  I see checkboxes now that allow be to select which credentials I want to download or download none.  I was not redirected anywhere after creating the account.  I filed GUI-2218 for that issue.
